intro: Aegiphila brenesii, commonly known as the Guanacaste shrub, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. Aegiphila brenesii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
